title: stf75stf wishlist

title: 20240421 source:intothelight

// Forbearance
//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Another weird choice to bring back as the origin trait on the original version is far better than this one, but it isn’t all bad as this version can be reborn with a new ability-battery identity. Using the origin trait as a starting point you can add both Demo and Wellspring to the gun to have massive ability regen. You can also get the original god roll of Ambitious Assassin + Chain Reaction here as well. And if you’re feeling like speculating on the market you can try investing in some damage perks that may overtake Chain Reaction once The Final Shape (and subsequent Chain Reaction nerf) is upon us. Overall I’m calling this #10 in priority for now." Masterwork: Reload
dimwishlist:item=568611921&perks=3525010810,2822142346,3523296417,3592538738
dimwishlist:item=568611921&perks=3525010810,2822142346,3523296417,2396489472
dimwishlist:item=568611921&perks=3525010810,2822142346,2010801679,3592538738
dimwishlist:item=568611921&perks=3525010810,2822142346,2010801679,2396489472

//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Another weird choice to bring back as the origin trait on the original version is far better than this one, but it isn’t all bad as this version can be reborn with a new ability-battery identity. Using the origin trait as a starting point you can add both Demo and Wellspring to the gun to have massive ability regen. You can also get the original god roll of Ambitious Assassin + Chain Reaction here as well. And if you’re feeling like speculating on the market you can try investing in some damage perks that may overtake Chain Reaction once The Final Shape (and subsequent Chain Reaction nerf) is upon us. Overall I’m calling this #10 in priority for now." Masterwork: Reload

// Forbearance (Holofoil)
//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Another weird choice to bring back as the origin trait on the original version is far better than this one, but it isn’t all bad as this version can be reborn with a new ability-battery identity. Using the origin trait as a starting point you can add both Demo and Wellspring to the gun to have massive ability regen. You can also get the original god roll of Ambitious Assassin + Chain Reaction here as well. And if you’re feeling like speculating on the market you can try investing in some damage perks that may overtake Chain Reaction once The Final Shape (and subsequent Chain Reaction nerf) is upon us. Overall I’m calling this #10 in priority for now." Masterwork: Reload
dimwishlist:item=2480074702&perks=3525010810,2822142346,3523296417,3592538738
dimwishlist:item=2480074702&perks=3525010810,2822142346,3523296417,2396489472
dimwishlist:item=2480074702&perks=3525010810,2822142346,2010801679,3592538738
dimwishlist:item=2480074702&perks=3525010810,2822142346,2010801679,2396489472

//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Another weird choice to bring back as the origin trait on the original version is far better than this one, but it isn’t all bad as this version can be reborn with a new ability-battery identity. Using the origin trait as a starting point you can add both Demo and Wellspring to the gun to have massive ability regen. You can also get the original god roll of Ambitious Assassin + Chain Reaction here as well. And if you’re feeling like speculating on the market you can try investing in some damage perks that may overtake Chain Reaction once The Final Shape (and subsequent Chain Reaction nerf) is upon us. Overall I’m calling this #10 in priority for now." Masterwork: Reload

//THE MOUNTAINTOP
//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "WOW. The madlads actually did it. This is one of the absolute most exciting weapons they’ve ever brought into the game. It has lightweight bonuses, fires in a straight line (basically a sniper rifle), now allows you to grenade jump (shoot at your feet to boost yourself), and does incredible damage. This archetype is also breaking rules regarding stats. On specifically just this weapon you want to try to drop your blast radius as far as you can, and Spike Grenades are also good. The perks are also just completely insane. Recombination should be completely insane for damage rotations as well as general play for bursting down majors. Frenzy deserves a shoutout for use in damage rotations or paired with Ambitious Assassin if you’d prefer to main the weapon. Vorpal may have some limited use in damage rotations, but should be worse than other options. Sticky Grenades is just an extra mobility option as you can stand on the grenades to climb into weird locations (at least you used to be able to, so I assume you still can). If it wasn’t for one other weapon being even more insane than this and only available in a limited capacity (just these 2 months) this would be the undisputed chase weapon. As it stands this is #2 in priority." Handling
dimwishlist:item=568611922&perks=981914802,3492396210,3300816228,469285294
dimwishlist:item=568611922&perks=981914802,3301904089,3300816228,469285294

//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "WOW. The madlads actually did it. This is one of the absolute most exciting weapons they’ve ever brought into the game. It has lightweight bonuses, fires in a straight line (basically a sniper rifle), now allows you to grenade jump (shoot at your feet to boost yourself), and does incredible damage. This archetype is also breaking rules regarding stats. On specifically just this weapon you want to try to drop your blast radius as far as you can, and Spike Grenades are also good. The perks are also just completely insane. Recombination should be completely insane for damage rotations as well as general play for bursting down majors. Frenzy deserves a shoutout for use in damage rotations or paired with Ambitious Assassin if you’d prefer to main the weapon. Vorpal may have some limited use in damage rotations, but should be worse than other options. Sticky Grenades is just an extra mobility option as you can stand on the grenades to climb into weird locations (at least you used to be able to, so I assume you still can). If it wasn’t for one other weapon being even more insane than this and only available in a limited capacity (just these 2 months) this would be the undisputed chase weapon. As it stands this is #2 in priority." Handling, Velocity, Reload

dimwishlist:item=568611922&perks=981914802,3301904089,3643424744,1546637391
dimwishlist:item=568611922&perks=3525010810,3301904089,3643424744,1546637391
dimwishlist:item=568611922&perks=981914802,3301904089,2010801679,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=568611922&perks=3525010810,3301904089,2010801679,4104185692



//THE MOUNTAINTOP (Holofoil)
//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "WOW. The madlads actually did it. This is one of the absolute most exciting weapons they’ve ever brought into the game. It has lightweight bonuses, fires in a straight line (basically a sniper rifle), now allows you to grenade jump (shoot at your feet to boost yourself), and does incredible damage. This archetype is also breaking rules regarding stats. On specifically just this weapon you want to try to drop your blast radius as far as you can, and Spike Grenades are also good. The perks are also just completely insane. Recombination should be completely insane for damage rotations as well as general play for bursting down majors. Frenzy deserves a shoutout for use in damage rotations or paired with Ambitious Assassin if you’d prefer to main the weapon. Vorpal may have some limited use in damage rotations, but should be worse than other options. Sticky Grenades is just an extra mobility option as you can stand on the grenades to climb into weird locations (at least you used to be able to, so I assume you still can). If it wasn’t for one other weapon being even more insane than this and only available in a limited capacity (just these 2 months) this would be the undisputed chase weapon. As it stands this is #2 in priority." Handling
dimwishlist:item=4043921923&perks=981914802,3492396210,3300816228,469285294
dimwishlist:item=4043921923&perks=981914802,3301904089,3300816228,469285294

//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "WOW. The madlads actually did it. This is one of the absolute most exciting weapons they’ve ever brought into the game. It has lightweight bonuses, fires in a straight line (basically a sniper rifle), now allows you to grenade jump (shoot at your feet to boost yourself), and does incredible damage. This archetype is also breaking rules regarding stats. On specifically just this weapon you want to try to drop your blast radius as far as you can, and Spike Grenades are also good. The perks are also just completely insane. Recombination should be completely insane for damage rotations as well as general play for bursting down majors. Frenzy deserves a shoutout for use in damage rotations or paired with Ambitious Assassin if you’d prefer to main the weapon. Vorpal may have some limited use in damage rotations, but should be worse than other options. Sticky Grenades is just an extra mobility option as you can stand on the grenades to climb into weird locations (at least you used to be able to, so I assume you still can). If it wasn’t for one other weapon being even more insane than this and only available in a limited capacity (just these 2 months) this would be the undisputed chase weapon. As it stands this is #2 in priority." Handling, Velocity, Reload

//EDGE TRANSIT
//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Still probably on par with if not better than Cataphract due to enhanced perks. You want a mag-boosting perk (either Augmented Drum or Mini Frags) paired with Backup Mag to use during the Envious Assassin add clear phase to boost the mag up to almost all of your reserves shifted over to the one overflowed mag before swapping over to Spike Grenades, or even just something that boosts velocity. Deconstruct is also performing well when paired with the Sticky Grenades mag perk since it only takes 2 direct hits to trigger the ammo refund from Deconstruct. This means you gain essentially 50% extra total damage across your reserves, assuming you’re in a situation where you can’t easily get more heavy ammo through other means and you’re in a long encounter with a lot of necessitated heavy weapon usage. It’s a pretty niche use case that most players will not usually get much value from, since in most cases you’re using the GL for its DPS value, not for total damage, so you’d be much happier with Bait & Switch or even Explosive Light in most cases. Lastly, do not pair Deconstruct with Envious Assassin, it is an anti-combo as the ammo refund can’t trigger when the mag is above its starting point. On top of all of this you can get pretty good PvP rolls as well, where you want as much Blast Radius as you can possibly get. Easily the #1 chase priority." Masterwork: Handling
dimwishlist:item=568611923&perks=981914802,1771897777,3751912585,3078487919

//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Still probably on par with if not better than Cataphract due to enhanced perks. You want a mag-boosting perk (either Augmented Drum or Mini Frags) paired with Backup Mag to use during the Envious Assassin add clear phase to boost the mag up to almost all of your reserves shifted over to the one overflowed mag before swapping over to Spike Grenades, or even just something that boosts velocity. Deconstruct is also performing well when paired with the Sticky Grenades mag perk since it only takes 2 direct hits to trigger the ammo refund from Deconstruct. This means you gain essentially 50% extra total damage across your reserves, assuming you’re in a situation where you can’t easily get more heavy ammo through other means and you’re in a long encounter with a lot of necessitated heavy weapon usage. It’s a pretty niche use case that most players will not usually get much value from, since in most cases you’re using the GL for its DPS value, not for total damage, so you’d be much happier with Bait & Switch or even Explosive Light in most cases. Lastly, do not pair Deconstruct with Envious Assassin, it is an anti-combo as the ammo refund can’t trigger when the mag is above its starting point. On top of all of this you can get pretty good PvP rolls as well, where you want as much Blast Radius as you can possibly get. Easily the #1 chase priority." Masterwork: Handling, Velocity, Reload

dimwishlist:item=568611923&perks=981914802,3301904089,2869569095,3194351027
dimwishlist:item=568611923&perks=981914802,3301904089,3300816228,3078487919
dimwishlist:item=568611923&perks=981914802,3301904089,3300816228,3194351027
dimwishlist:item=568611923&perks=981914802,3301904089,968510818,3078487919
dimwishlist:item=568611923&perks=981914802,3301904089,968510818,3194351027
dimwishlist:item=568611923&perks=3525010810,3301904089,3751912585,3078487919
dimwishlist:item=568611923&perks=3525010810,3301904089,3751912585,3194351027
dimwishlist:item=568611923&perks=3525010810,3301904089,2869569095,3078487919
dimwishlist:item=568611923&perks=3525010810,3301904089,2869569095,3194351027
dimwishlist:item=568611923&perks=3525010810,3301904089,3300816228,3078487919
dimwishlist:item=568611923&perks=3525010810,3301904089,3300816228,3194351027
dimwishlist:item=568611923&perks=3525010810,3301904089,968510818,3078487919
dimwishlist:item=568611923&perks=3525010810,3301904089,968510818,3194351027

//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVP) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Still probably on par with if not better than Cataphract due to enhanced perks. You want a mag-boosting perk (either Augmented Drum or Mini Frags) paired with Backup Mag to use during the Envious Assassin add clear phase to boost the mag up to almost all of your reserves shifted over to the one overflowed mag before swapping over to Spike Grenades, or even just something that boosts velocity. Deconstruct is also performing well when paired with the Sticky Grenades mag perk since it only takes 2 direct hits to trigger the ammo refund from Deconstruct. This means you gain essentially 50% extra total damage across your reserves, assuming you’re in a situation where you can’t easily get more heavy ammo through other means and you’re in a long encounter with a lot of necessitated heavy weapon usage. It’s a pretty niche use case that most players will not usually get much value from, since in most cases you’re using the GL for its DPS value, not for total damage, so you’d be much happier with Bait & Switch or even Explosive Light in most cases. Lastly, do not pair Deconstruct with Envious Assassin, it is an anti-combo as the ammo refund can’t trigger when the mag is above its starting point. On top of all of this you can get pretty good PvP rolls as well, where you want as much Blast Radius as you can possibly get. Easily the #1 chase priority." Masterwork: Blast Radius
dimwishlist:item=568611923&perks=1478423395,1380253176,951095735,3993379141

//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVP) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Still probably on par with if not better than Cataphract due to enhanced perks. You want a mag-boosting perk (either Augmented Drum or Mini Frags) paired with Backup Mag to use during the Envious Assassin add clear phase to boost the mag up to almost all of your reserves shifted over to the one overflowed mag before swapping over to Spike Grenades, or even just something that boosts velocity. Deconstruct is also performing well when paired with the Sticky Grenades mag perk since it only takes 2 direct hits to trigger the ammo refund from Deconstruct. This means you gain essentially 50% extra total damage across your reserves, assuming you’re in a situation where you can’t easily get more heavy ammo through other means and you’re in a long encounter with a lot of necessitated heavy weapon usage. It’s a pretty niche use case that most players will not usually get much value from, since in most cases you’re using the GL for its DPS value, not for total damage, so you’d be much happier with Bait & Switch or even Explosive Light in most cases. Lastly, do not pair Deconstruct with Envious Assassin, it is an anti-combo as the ammo refund can’t trigger when the mag is above its starting point. On top of all of this you can get pretty good PvP rolls as well, where you want as much Blast Radius as you can possibly get. Easily the #1 chase priority." Masterwork: Blast Radius

//EDGE TRANSIT (Holofoil)
//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Still probably on par with if not better than Cataphract due to enhanced perks. You want a mag-boosting perk (either Augmented Drum or Mini Frags) paired with Backup Mag to use during the Envious Assassin add clear phase to boost the mag up to almost all of your reserves shifted over to the one overflowed mag before swapping over to Spike Grenades, or even just something that boosts velocity. Deconstruct is also performing well when paired with the Sticky Grenades mag perk since it only takes 2 direct hits to trigger the ammo refund from Deconstruct. This means you gain essentially 50% extra total damage across your reserves, assuming you’re in a situation where you can’t easily get more heavy ammo through other means and you’re in a long encounter with a lot of necessitated heavy weapon usage. It’s a pretty niche use case that most players will not usually get much value from, since in most cases you’re using the GL for its DPS value, not for total damage, so you’d be much happier with Bait & Switch or even Explosive Light in most cases. Lastly, do not pair Deconstruct with Envious Assassin, it is an anti-combo as the ammo refund can’t trigger when the mag is above its starting point. On top of all of this you can get pretty good PvP rolls as well, where you want as much Blast Radius as you can possibly get. Easily the #1 chase priority." Masterwork: Handling

//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Still probably on par with if not better than Cataphract due to enhanced perks. You want a mag-boosting perk (either Augmented Drum or Mini Frags) paired with Backup Mag to use during the Envious Assassin add clear phase to boost the mag up to almost all of your reserves shifted over to the one overflowed mag before swapping over to Spike Grenades, or even just something that boosts velocity. Deconstruct is also performing well when paired with the Sticky Grenades mag perk since it only takes 2 direct hits to trigger the ammo refund from Deconstruct. This means you gain essentially 50% extra total damage across your reserves, assuming you’re in a situation where you can’t easily get more heavy ammo through other means and you’re in a long encounter with a lot of necessitated heavy weapon usage. It’s a pretty niche use case that most players will not usually get much value from, since in most cases you’re using the GL for its DPS value, not for total damage, so you’d be much happier with Bait & Switch or even Explosive Light in most cases. Lastly, do not pair Deconstruct with Envious Assassin, it is an anti-combo as the ammo refund can’t trigger when the mag is above its starting point. On top of all of this you can get pretty good PvP rolls as well, where you want as much Blast Radius as you can possibly get. Easily the #1 chase priority." Masterwork: Handling, Velocity, Reload

dimwishlist:item=2228325504&perks=981914802,3301904089,2869569095,3078487919
dimwishlist:item=2228325504&perks=981914802,3301904089,2869569095,3194351027
dimwishlist:item=2228325504&perks=981914802,3301904089,3300816228,3078487919
dimwishlist:item=2228325504&perks=981914802,3301904089,3300816228,3194351027
dimwishlist:item=2228325504&perks=981914802,3301904089,968510818,3078487919
dimwishlist:item=2228325504&perks=981914802,3301904089,968510818,3194351027
dimwishlist:item=2228325504&perks=3525010810,3301904089,3751912585,3078487919
dimwishlist:item=2228325504&perks=3525010810,3301904089,3751912585,3194351027
dimwishlist:item=2228325504&perks=3525010810,3301904089,2869569095,3078487919
dimwishlist:item=2228325504&perks=3525010810,3301904089,2869569095,3194351027
dimwishlist:item=2228325504&perks=3525010810,3301904089,3300816228,3078487919
dimwishlist:item=2228325504&perks=3525010810,3301904089,3300816228,3194351027
dimwishlist:item=2228325504&perks=3525010810,3301904089,968510818,3078487919
dimwishlist:item=2228325504&perks=3525010810,3301904089,968510818,3194351027

//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVP) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Still probably on par with if not better than Cataphract due to enhanced perks. You want a mag-boosting perk (either Augmented Drum or Mini Frags) paired with Backup Mag to use during the Envious Assassin add clear phase to boost the mag up to almost all of your reserves shifted over to the one overflowed mag before swapping over to Spike Grenades, or even just something that boosts velocity. Deconstruct is also performing well when paired with the Sticky Grenades mag perk since it only takes 2 direct hits to trigger the ammo refund from Deconstruct. This means you gain essentially 50% extra total damage across your reserves, assuming you’re in a situation where you can’t easily get more heavy ammo through other means and you’re in a long encounter with a lot of necessitated heavy weapon usage. It’s a pretty niche use case that most players will not usually get much value from, since in most cases you’re using the GL for its DPS value, not for total damage, so you’d be much happier with Bait & Switch or even Explosive Light in most cases. Lastly, do not pair Deconstruct with Envious Assassin, it is an anti-combo as the ammo refund can’t trigger when the mag is above its starting point. On top of all of this you can get pretty good PvP rolls as well, where you want as much Blast Radius as you can possibly get. Easily the #1 chase priority." Masterwork: Blast Radius
dimwishlist:item=2228325504&perks=1478423395,1380253176,951095735,3993379141

//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVP) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Still probably on par with if not better than Cataphract due to enhanced perks. You want a mag-boosting perk (either Augmented Drum or Mini Frags) paired with Backup Mag to use during the Envious Assassin add clear phase to boost the mag up to almost all of your reserves shifted over to the one overflowed mag before swapping over to Spike Grenades, or even just something that boosts velocity. Deconstruct is also performing well when paired with the Sticky Grenades mag perk since it only takes 2 direct hits to trigger the ammo refund from Deconstruct. This means you gain essentially 50% extra total damage across your reserves, assuming you’re in a situation where you can’t easily get more heavy ammo through other means and you’re in a long encounter with a lot of necessitated heavy weapon usage. It’s a pretty niche use case that most players will not usually get much value from, since in most cases you’re using the GL for its DPS value, not for total damage, so you’d be much happier with Bait & Switch or even Explosive Light in most cases. Lastly, do not pair Deconstruct with Envious Assassin, it is an anti-combo as the ammo refund can’t trigger when the mag is above its starting point. On top of all of this you can get pretty good PvP rolls as well, where you want as much Blast Radius as you can possibly get. Easily the #1 chase priority." Masterwork: Blast Radius

// THE RECLUSE
//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "The hype for this returning former juggernaut has died down a lot, but it should still be the best void submachine gun if you can get your hands on the right roll. Enlightened Action + Desperate Measures or Surrounded (especially good in Onslaught) for a general use weapon, or Repulsor Brace + Frenzy for Gyrfalcon Hunter. Desperate Measures seems to fall off really easily if you have volatile rounds on your weapon, so I would not recommend using that on Gyrfalcon. Due to its BiS categorization this picks up a #5 priority." Masterwork: Reload
dimwishlist:item=1050806815&perks=3250034553,3230963543,3828510309,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=1050806815&perks=3250034553,3230963543,3828510309,3708227201
dimwishlist:item=1050806815&perks=3250034553,3230963543,776531651,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=1050806815&perks=3250034553,3230963543,776531651,3708227201

//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "The hype for this returning former juggernaut has died down a lot, but it should still be the best void submachine gun if you can get your hands on the right roll. Enlightened Action + Desperate Measures or Surrounded (especially good in Onslaught) for a general use weapon, or Repulsor Brace + Frenzy for Gyrfalcon Hunter. Desperate Measures seems to fall off really easily if you have volatile rounds on your weapon, so I would not recommend using that on Gyrfalcon. Due to its BiS categorization this picks up a #5 priority." Masterwork: Reload, Range

// THE RECLUSE (Holofoil)
//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "The hype for this returning former juggernaut has died down a lot, but it should still be the best void submachine gun if you can get your hands on the right roll. Enlightened Action + Desperate Measures or Surrounded (especially good in Onslaught) for a general use weapon, or Repulsor Brace + Frenzy for Gyrfalcon Hunter. Desperate Measures seems to fall off really easily if you have volatile rounds on your weapon, so I would not recommend using that on Gyrfalcon. Due to its BiS categorization this picks up a #5 priority." Masterwork: Reload
dimwishlist:item=3098328572&perks=3250034553,3230963543,3828510309,4104185692

//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "The hype for this returning former juggernaut has died down a lot, but it should still be the best void submachine gun if you can get your hands on the right roll. Enlightened Action + Desperate Measures or Surrounded (especially good in Onslaught) for a general use weapon, or Repulsor Brace + Frenzy for Gyrfalcon Hunter. Desperate Measures seems to fall off really easily if you have volatile rounds on your weapon, so I would not recommend using that on Gyrfalcon. Due to its BiS categorization this picks up a #5 priority." Masterwork: Reload, Range

// HUNG JURY SR4
//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Oh look. It’s back again. For some reason. Yay? And oof, they put the PvE god roll of Shoot to Loot + Kinetic Tremors in the same column so you can’t get it on this one; so, right away this version of Hung Jury is strictly worse than the last Nightfall version for that reason. You can get Tremors + Firefly which is somewhat interesting, but is definitely not worth using over the previous version of the gun. For PvP they left the Box Breathing roll just as is, so this gives everyone another chance to pick up that roll - which is absolute dynamite in the crucible. For me, having the Box Breathing god roll already this drops to the bottom of the priority list (#11), but if you don’t have the Box Breathing roll you can chase it." Masterwork: Reload
dimwishlist:item=1453235079&perks=1840239774,3230963543,3891536761,3824105627

// HUNG JURY SR4 (Holofoil)
//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Oh look. It’s back again. For some reason. Yay? And oof, they put the PvE god roll of Shoot to Loot + Kinetic Tremors in the same column so you can’t get it on this one; so, right away this version of Hung Jury is strictly worse than the last Nightfall version for that reason. You can get Tremors + Firefly which is somewhat interesting, but is definitely not worth using over the previous version of the gun. For PvP they left the Box Breathing roll just as is, so this gives everyone another chance to pick up that roll - which is absolute dynamite in the crucible. For me, having the Box Breathing god roll already this drops to the bottom of the priority list (#11), but if you don’t have the Box Breathing roll you can chase it." Masterwork: Reload
dimwishlist:item=205225492&perks=1840239774,3230963543,3891536761,3824105627
dimwishlist:item=205225492&perks=1840239774,3230963543,3891536761,3038247973

//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Oh look. It’s back again. For some reason. Yay? And oof, they put the PvE god roll of Shoot to Loot + Kinetic Tremors in the same column so you can’t get it on this one; so, right away this version of Hung Jury is strictly worse than the last Nightfall version for that reason. You can get Tremors + Firefly which is somewhat interesting, but is definitely not worth using over the previous version of the gun. For PvP they left the Box Breathing roll just as is, so this gives everyone another chance to pick up that roll - which is absolute dynamite in the crucible. For me, having the Box Breathing god roll already this drops to the bottom of the priority list (#11), but if you don’t have the Box Breathing roll you can chase it." Masterwork: Reload, Handling

//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVP) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Oh look. It’s back again. For some reason. Yay? dimwishlist:item=205225492&perks=1840239774,3177308360,2866798147,2551157718

//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVP) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Oh look. It’s back again. For some reason. Yay? And oof, they put the PvE god roll of Shoot to Loot + Kinetic Tremors in the same column so you can’t get it on this one; so, right away this version of Hung Jury is strictly worse than the last Nightfall version for that reason. You can get Tremors + Firefly which is somewhat interesting, but is definitely not worth using over the previous version of the gun. For PvP they left the Box Breathing roll just as is, so this gives everyone another chance to pick up that roll - which is absolute dynamite in the crucible. For me, having the Box Breathing god roll already this drops to the bottom of the priority list (#11), but if you don’t have the Box Breathing roll you can chase it." Masterwork: Stability, Handling

//FALLING GUILLOTINE
//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Vortex frame swords are horrible for dps right now. The heavy attack is a net dps loss as it costs 6 ammo when 4 light swings are an equivalent amount of damage. You can get double damage perks on this, but without relentless strikes your total damage will absolutely plummet since you can’t print ammo while you attack. Like so many other swords before it, this weapon with Surrounded (even when enhanced in TFS) can’t compete with Bequest simply due to Bequest’s unnatural extra 10 impact stat it has over all other swords. However, Bequest is only the top dog if you can guarantee you have Surrounded proc’d. Once you lose that then things like The Lament start coming into play - and that’s where this sword might actually come through. As long as you’re sure you can completely eschew total damage (sacrificing Relentless Strikes in column 1 for a damage perk) then the straight DPS of Frenzy/Vorpal + Bait & Switch might be a legit meta DPS option for situations where you can’t proc surrounded (e.g. Caiatl in Duality dungeon). We can speculate for the future looking at a potential buff to vortex frames or swords in general and this weapon is all upside if that winds up being the case. It may be worth picking up a roll with double damage perks just in case these ever become meta again. Calling this #9 in priority." Masterwork: Impact
dimwishlist:item=1815105249&perks=3666208348,269888150,4104185692,3708227201
dimwishlist:item=1815105249&perks=3666208348,269888150,4104185692,3078487919

//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Vortex frame swords are horrible for dps right now. The heavy attack is a net dps loss as it costs 6 ammo when 4 light swings are an equivalent amount of damage. You can get double damage perks on this, but without relentless strikes your total damage will absolutely plummet since you can’t print ammo while you attack. Like so many other swords before it, this weapon with Surrounded (even when enhanced in TFS) can’t compete with Bequest simply due to Bequest’s unnatural extra 10 impact stat it has over all other swords. However, Bequest is only the top dog if you can guarantee you have Surrounded proc’d. Once you lose that then things like The Lament start coming into play - and that’s where this sword might actually come through. As long as you’re sure you can completely eschew total damage (sacrificing Relentless Strikes in column 1 for a damage perk) then the straight DPS of Frenzy/Vorpal + Bait & Switch might be a legit meta DPS option for situations where you can’t proc surrounded (e.g. Caiatl in Duality dungeon). We can speculate for the future looking at a potential buff to vortex frames or swords in general and this weapon is all upside if that winds up being the case. It may be worth picking up a roll with double damage perks just in case these ever become meta again. Calling this #9 in priority." Masterwork: Impact

//FALLING GUILLOTINE (Holofoil)
//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Vortex frame swords are horrible for dps right now. The heavy attack is a net dps loss as it costs 6 ammo when 4 light swings are an equivalent amount of damage. You can get double damage perks on this, but without relentless strikes your total damage will absolutely plummet since you can’t print ammo while you attack. Like so many other swords before it, this weapon with Surrounded (even when enhanced in TFS) can’t compete with Bequest simply due to Bequest’s unnatural extra 10 impact stat it has over all other swords. However, Bequest is only the top dog if you can guarantee you have Surrounded proc’d. Once you lose that then things like The Lament start coming into play - and that’s where this sword might actually come through. As long as you’re sure you can completely eschew total damage (sacrificing Relentless Strikes in column 1 for a damage perk) then the straight DPS of Frenzy/Vorpal + Bait & Switch might be a legit meta DPS option for situations where you can’t proc surrounded (e.g. Caiatl in Duality dungeon). We can speculate for the future looking at a potential buff to vortex frames or swords in general and this weapon is all upside if that winds up being the case. It may be worth picking up a roll with double damage perks just in case these ever become meta again. Calling this #9 in priority." Masterwork: Impact
dimwishlist:item=243425374&perks=3666208348,269888150,4104185692,3708227201
dimwishlist:item=243425374&perks=3666208348,269888150,4104185692,3078487919

//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Vortex frame swords are horrible for dps right now. The heavy attack is a net dps loss as it costs 6 ammo when 4 light swings are an equivalent amount of damage. You can get double damage perks on this, but without relentless strikes your total damage will absolutely plummet since you can’t print ammo while you attack. Like so many other swords before it, this weapon with Surrounded (even when enhanced in TFS) can’t compete with Bequest simply due to Bequest’s unnatural extra 10 impact stat it has over all other swords. However, Bequest is only the top dog if you can guarantee you have Surrounded proc’d. Once you lose that then things like The Lament start coming into play - and that’s where this sword might actually come through. As long as you’re sure you can completely eschew total damage (sacrificing Relentless Strikes in column 1 for a damage perk) then the straight DPS of Frenzy/Vorpal + Bait & Switch might be a legit meta DPS option for situations where you can’t proc surrounded (e.g. Caiatl in Duality dungeon). We can speculate for the future looking at a potential buff to vortex frames or swords in general and this weapon is all upside if that winds up being the case. It may be worth picking up a roll with double damage perks just in case these ever become meta again. Calling this #9 in priority." Masterwork: Impact

//HAMMERHEAD
//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "I was really excited for this gun to come back and it came back strong in some ways and mediocre in others. As the standard “void MG” it cannot compete with Commemoration. Reconstruction + Killing Tally on that gun can’t be beaten by anything this gun can do. Rewind Rounds is a pale shadow of Reconstruction, Bray Inheritance is way stronger than Indomitability. However, this can roll double lethality perks in the forms of Rampage in column 1 plus Onslaught or Killing Tally in column 2. Specifically on Void Hunter, and Hunter in general for that matter, you can use dodge to bypass the truly odious reload time of a machine gun and maintain the massive damage capability of the double damage perks. Sadly, Hunter dodge will reset Killing Tally, but that’s not necessarily the end of the world. It can also get a pretty good counter-meta PvP roll as well. Overall this is my #8 chase priority weapon." Masterwork: Handling
dimwishlist:item=1896309757&perks=1840239774,1087426260,3425386926,95528736
dimwishlist:item=1896309757&perks=1840239774,1968497646,3425386926,95528736
dimwishlist:item=1896309757&perks=1840239774,1561002382,3425386926,95528736

//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "I was really excited for this gun to come back and it came back strong in some ways and mediocre in others. As the standard “void MG” it cannot compete with Commemoration. Reconstruction + Killing Tally on that gun can’t be beaten by anything this gun can do. Rewind Rounds is a pale shadow of Reconstruction, Bray Inheritance is way stronger than Indomitability. However, this can roll double lethality perks in the forms of Rampage in column 1 plus Onslaught or Killing Tally in column 2. Specifically on Void Hunter, and Hunter in general for that matter, you can use dodge to bypass the truly odious reload time of a machine gun and maintain the massive damage capability of the double damage perks. Sadly, Hunter dodge will reset Killing Tally, but that’s not necessarily the end of the world. It can also get a pretty good counter-meta PvP roll as well. Overall this is my #8 chase priority weapon." Masterwork: Handling, Reload

//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVP) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "I was really excited for this gun to come back and it came back strong in some ways and mediocre in others. As the standard “void MG” it cannot compete with Commemoration. Reconstruction + Killing Tally on that gun can’t be beaten by anything this gun can do. Rewind Rounds is a pale shadow of Reconstruction, Bray Inheritance is way stronger than Indomitability. However, this can roll double lethality perks in the forms of Rampage in column 1 plus Onslaught or Killing Tally in column 2. Specifically on Void Hunter, and Hunter in general for that matter, you can use dodge to bypass the truly odious reload time of a machine gun and maintain the massive damage capability of the double damage perks. Sadly, Hunter dodge will reset Killing Tally, but that’s not necessarily the end of the world. It can also get a pretty good counter-meta PvP roll as well. Overall this is my #8 chase priority weapon." Masterwork: Handling

//HAMMERHEAD (Holofoil)
//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "I was really excited for this gun to come back and it came back strong in some ways and mediocre in others. As the standard “void MG” it cannot compete with Commemoration. Reconstruction + Killing Tally on that gun can’t be beaten by anything this gun can do. Rewind Rounds is a pale shadow of Reconstruction, Bray Inheritance is way stronger than Indomitability. However, this can roll double lethality perks in the forms of Rampage in column 1 plus Onslaught or Killing Tally in column 2. Specifically on Void Hunter, and Hunter in general for that matter, you can use dodge to bypass the truly odious reload time of a machine gun and maintain the massive damage capability of the double damage perks. Sadly, Hunter dodge will reset Killing Tally, but that’s not necessarily the end of the world. It can also get a pretty good counter-meta PvP roll as well. Overall this is my #8 chase priority weapon." Masterwork: Handling
dimwishlist:item=211732170&perks=1840239774,1087426260,3425386926,95528736
dimwishlist:item=211732170&perks=1840239774,1968497646,3425386926,95528736
dimwishlist:item=211732170&perks=1840239774,1561002382,3425386926,95528736

//BLAST FURNACE
//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Aggressive Bursts have been in a weird place for awhile in Destiny. The deterministic recoil on this weapon will be the main factor in whether or not this is usable in PvP. If it is usable this should wind up being a very solid gun, along the lines of a Belisarius-D. For PvE there is basically just one roll you’d be looking for with Kinetic Tremors and Frenzy, and that may very well be good enough to break into high-end content over the likes of a perfect Battle Scar. The combination of the QoL buffs and damage from Frenzy, the enhanced perks (once TFS launches), and the origin trait being better may all place this above a classic Shoot to Loot + Tremors pulse like Battle Scar. If you like the gun it should be a fun nostalgic weapon to pick up and use. #6 priority, middle of the pack." Masterwork: Reload
dimwishlist:item=2372514508&perks=4090651448,3230963543,3891536761,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=2372514508&perks=1840239774,3230963543,3891536761,4104185692

//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Aggressive Bursts have been in a weird place for awhile in Destiny. For PvE there is basically just one roll you’d be looking for with Kinetic Tremors and Frenzy, and that may very well be good enough to break into high-end content over the likes of a perfect Battle Scar. The combination of the QoL buffs and damage from Frenzy, the enhanced perks (once TFS launches), and the origin trait being better may all place this above a classic Shoot to Loot + Tremors pulse like Battle Scar. If you like the gun it should be a fun nostalgic weapon to pick up and use. #6 priority, middle of the pack." Masterwork: Reload

//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVP) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Aggressive Bursts have been in a weird place for awhile in Destiny. For PvE there is basically just one roll you’d be looking for with Kinetic Tremors and Frenzy, and that may very well be good enough to break into high-end content over the likes of a perfect Battle Scar. The combination of the QoL buffs and damage from Frenzy, the enhanced perks (once TFS launches), and the origin trait being better may all place this above a classic Shoot to Loot + Tremors pulse like Battle Scar. If you like the gun it should be a fun nostalgic weapon to pick up and use. #6 priority, middle of the pack." Masterwork: Range

//BLAST FURNACE (Holofoil)
//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Aggressive Bursts have been in a weird place for awhile in Destiny. The deterministic recoil on this weapon will be the main factor in whether or not this is usable in PvP. If it is usable this should wind up being a very solid gun, along the lines of a Belisarius-D. For PvE there is basically just one roll you’d be looking for with Kinetic Tremors and Frenzy, and that may very well be good enough to break into high-end content over the likes of a perfect Battle Scar. The combination of the QoL buffs and damage from Frenzy, the enhanced perks (once TFS launches), and the origin trait being better may all place this above a classic Shoot to Loot + Tremors pulse like Battle Scar. If you like the gun it should be a fun nostalgic weapon to pick up and use. #6 priority, middle of the pack." Masterwork: Reload
dimwishlist:item=2533990645&perks=4090651448,3230963543,3891536761,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=2533990645&perks=1840239774,3230963543,3891536761,4104185692

//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Aggressive Bursts have been in a weird place for awhile in Destiny. The deterministic recoil on this weapon will be the main factor in whether or not this is usable in PvP. If it is usable this should wind up being a very solid gun, along the lines of a Belisarius-D. For PvE there is basically just one roll you’d be looking for with Kinetic Tremors and Frenzy, and that may very well be good enough to break into high-end content over the likes of a perfect Battle Scar. The combination of the QoL buffs and damage from Frenzy, the enhanced perks (once TFS launches), and the origin trait being better may all place this above a classic Shoot to Loot + Tremors pulse like Battle Scar. If you like the gun it should be a fun nostalgic weapon to pick up and use. #6 priority, middle of the pack." Masterwork: Reload

dimwishlist:item=2533990645&perks=1482024992,106909392,3891536761,3824105627

//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVP) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Aggressive Bursts have been in a weird place for awhile in Destiny. The deterministic recoil on this weapon will be the main factor in whether or not this is usable in PvP. If it is usable this should wind up being a very solid gun, along the lines of a Belisarius-D. For PvE there is basically just one roll you’d be looking for with Kinetic Tremors and Frenzy, and that may very well be good enough to break into high-end content over the likes of a perfect Battle Scar. The combination of the QoL buffs and damage from Frenzy, the enhanced perks (once TFS launches), and the origin trait being better may all place this above a classic Shoot to Loot + Tremors pulse like Battle Scar. If you like the gun it should be a fun nostalgic weapon to pick up and use. #6 priority, middle of the pack." Masterwork: Range
dimwishlist:item=2533990645&perks=3250034553,3142289711,2387244414,247725512
dimwishlist:item=2533990645&perks=3250034553,3142289711,3619207468,247725512
dimwishlist:item=2533990645&perks=3250034553,3142289711,460017080,247725512

//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVP) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Aggressive Bursts have been in a weird place for awhile in Destiny. The deterministic recoil on this weapon will be the main factor in whether or not this is usable in PvP. If it is usable this should wind up being a very solid gun, along the lines of a Belisarius-D. For PvE there is basically just one roll you’d be looking for with Kinetic Tremors and Frenzy, and that may very well be good enough to break into high-end content over the likes of a perfect Battle Scar. The combination of the QoL buffs and damage from Frenzy, the enhanced perks (once TFS launches), and the origin trait being better may all place this above a classic Shoot to Loot + Tremors pulse like Battle Scar. If you like the gun it should be a fun nostalgic weapon to pick up and use. #6 priority, middle of the pack." Masterwork: Range, Handling, Stability

// ELSIE'S RIFLE
//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Tough weapon to judge for PvE. On the surface it looks underwhelming, but there are some interesting perks in here to note. I should also note that this weapon has literally double the base reload of the rest of its archetype. 60 base reload is insane here and should not be overlooked. Perks-wise this has some ok perks for clearing low-level content like Desperate Measures, Kill Clip, and Adrenaline Junkie, but the fact that this is a void weapon hurts the use case for all of those due to subclass limitations. That leaves Frenzy as the premiere choice for high-end content and oh boy Under-Over and Repulsor Brace as pairings are super juicy here. Under-Over would be ideal for the next time we get an anti-barrier season and Repulsor Brace should be the far more ubiquitous choice for Gyrfalcon Hunter. Overall though this archetype isn’t really used much in PvE. For PvP this can hit max range with the aid of Keep Away and looks like it could be very, very strong - unfortunately the deterministic recoil pattern is horrible on this weapon. Do not run a counterbalance mod, in any configuration it just pulls the recoil poorly. You need one of the 3 recoil-adjusting barrel perks to make this usable at all, preferably Extended Barrel being the premiere choice. The base stats on Elsie’s are huge. It’s like having a Messenger with 3 adept mods already on it (2 in reload, 1 in handling). Overall, this is looking like a great chase for PvP, so making it a #4 prio. " Masterwork: Reload
dimwishlist:item=2372514509&perks=839105230,3230963543,1870851715,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=2372514509&perks=1467527085,3230963543,1870851715,4104185692

//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Tough weapon to judge for PvE. On the surface it looks underwhelming, but there are some interesting perks in here to note. I should also note that this weapon has literally double the base reload of the rest of its archetype. 60 base reload is insane here and should not be overlooked. Perks-wise this has some ok perks for clearing low-level content like Desperate Measures, Kill Clip, and Adrenaline Junkie, but the fact that this is a void weapon hurts the use case for all of those due to subclass limitations. That leaves Frenzy as the premiere choice for high-end content and oh boy Under-Over and Repulsor Brace as pairings are super juicy here. Under-Over would be ideal for the next time we get an anti-barrier season and Repulsor Brace should be the far more ubiquitous choice for Gyrfalcon Hunter. Overall though this archetype isn’t really used much in PvE. For PvP this can hit max range with the aid of Keep Away and looks like it could be very, very strong - unfortunately the deterministic recoil pattern is horrible on this weapon. Do not run a counterbalance mod, in any configuration it just pulls the recoil poorly. You need one of the 3 recoil-adjusting barrel perks to make this usable at all, preferably Extended Barrel being the premiere choice. The base stats on Elsie’s are huge. It’s like having a Messenger with 3 adept mods already on it (2 in reload, 1 in handling). Overall, this is looking like a great chase for PvP, so making it a #4 prio. " Masterwork: Reload, Handling

//notes: giornogaming (PVE) build da vuoto backup https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OSzK2hnXvtY
dimwishlist:item=2372514509&perks=776531651,2048641572
dimwishlist:item=2372514509&perks=3418782618,3047969693
dimwishlist:item=2372514509&perks=3418782618,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=2372514509&perks=2779035018,2048641572

//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVP) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Tough weapon to judge for PvE. On the surface it looks underwhelming, but there are some interesting perks in here to note. I should also note that this weapon has literally double the base reload of the rest of its archetype. 60 base reload is insane here and should not be overlooked. Perks-wise this has some ok perks for clearing low-level content like Desperate Measures, Kill Clip, and Adrenaline Junkie, but the fact that this is a void weapon hurts the use case for all of those due to subclass limitations. That leaves Frenzy as the premiere choice for high-end content and oh boy Under-Over and Repulsor Brace as pairings are super juicy here. Under-Over would be ideal for the next time we get an anti-barrier season and Repulsor Brace should be the far more ubiquitous choice for Gyrfalcon Hunter. Overall though this archetype isn’t really used much in PvE. For PvP this can hit max range with the aid of Keep Away and looks like it could be very, very strong - unfortunately the deterministic recoil pattern is horrible on this weapon. Do not run a counterbalance mod, in any configuration it just pulls the recoil poorly. You need one of the 3 recoil-adjusting barrel perks to make this usable at all, preferably Extended Barrel being the premiere choice. The base stats on Elsie’s are huge. It’s like having a Messenger with 3 adept mods already on it (2 in reload, 1 in handling). Overall, this is looking like a great chase for PvP, so making it a #4 prio. " Masterwork: Range
dimwishlist:item=2372514509&perks=1467527085,1885400500,2387244414,460017080

//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVP) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Tough weapon to judge for PvE. On the surface it looks underwhelming, but there are some interesting perks in here to note. I should also note that this weapon has literally double the base reload of the rest of its archetype. 60 base reload is insane here and should not be overlooked. Perks-wise this has some ok perks for clearing low-level content like Desperate Measures, Kill Clip, and Adrenaline Junkie, but the fact that this is a void weapon hurts the use case for all of those due to subclass limitations. That leaves Frenzy as the premiere choice for high-end content and oh boy Under-Over and Repulsor Brace as pairings are super juicy here. Under-Over would be ideal for the next time we get an anti-barrier season and Repulsor Brace should be the far more ubiquitous choice for Gyrfalcon Hunter. Overall though this archetype isn’t really used much in PvE. For PvP this can hit max range with the aid of Keep Away and looks like it could be very, very strong - unfortunately the deterministic recoil pattern is horrible on this weapon. Do not run a counterbalance mod, in any configuration it just pulls the recoil poorly. You need one of the 3 recoil-adjusting barrel perks to make this usable at all, preferably Extended Barrel being the premiere choice. The base stats on Elsie’s are huge. It’s like having a Messenger with 3 adept mods already on it (2 in reload, 1 in handling). Overall, this is looking like a great chase for PvP, so making it a #4 prio. " Masterwork: Range

// ELSIE'S RIFLE (Holofoil)
//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Tough weapon to judge for PvE. On the surface it looks underwhelming, but there are some interesting perks in here to note. I should also note that this weapon has literally double the base reload of the rest of its archetype. 60 base reload is insane here and should not be overlooked. Perks-wise this has some ok perks for clearing low-level content like Desperate Measures, Kill Clip, and Adrenaline Junkie, but the fact that this is a void weapon hurts the use case for all of those due to subclass limitations. That leaves Frenzy as the premiere choice for high-end content and oh boy Under-Over and Repulsor Brace as pairings are super juicy here. Under-Over would be ideal for the next time we get an anti-barrier season and Repulsor Brace should be the far more ubiquitous choice for Gyrfalcon Hunter. Overall though this archetype isn’t really used much in PvE. For PvP this can hit max range with the aid of Keep Away and looks like it could be very, very strong - unfortunately the deterministic recoil pattern is horrible on this weapon. Do not run a counterbalance mod, in any configuration it just pulls the recoil poorly. You need one of the 3 recoil-adjusting barrel perks to make this usable at all, preferably Extended Barrel being the premiere choice. The base stats on Elsie’s are huge. It’s like having a Messenger with 3 adept mods already on it (2 in reload, 1 in handling). Overall, this is looking like a great chase for PvP, so making it a #4 prio. " Masterwork: Reload
dimwishlist:item=3851176026&perks=839105230,3230963543,1870851715,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=3851176026&perks=1467527085,3230963543,1870851715,4104185692

//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Tough weapon to judge for PvE. On the surface it looks underwhelming, but there are some interesting perks in here to note. I should also note that this weapon has literally double the base reload of the rest of its archetype. 60 base reload is insane here and should not be overlooked. Perks-wise this has some ok perks for clearing low-level content like Desperate Measures, Kill Clip, and Adrenaline Junkie, but the fact that this is a void weapon hurts the use case for all of those due to subclass limitations. That leaves Frenzy as the premiere choice for high-end content and oh boy Under-Over and Repulsor Brace as pairings are super juicy here. Under-Over would be ideal for the next time we get an anti-barrier season and Repulsor Brace should be the far more ubiquitous choice for Gyrfalcon Hunter. Overall though this archetype isn’t really used much in PvE. For PvP this can hit max range with the aid of Keep Away and looks like it could be very, very strong - unfortunately the deterministic recoil pattern is horrible on this weapon. Do not run a counterbalance mod, in any configuration it just pulls the recoil poorly. You need one of the 3 recoil-adjusting barrel perks to make this usable at all, preferably Extended Barrel being the premiere choice. The base stats on Elsie’s are huge. It’s like having a Messenger with 3 adept mods already on it (2 in reload, 1 in handling). Overall, this is looking like a great chase for PvP, so making it a #4 prio. " Masterwork: Reload, Handling

dimwishlist:item=3851176026&perks=776531651,2048641572
dimwishlist:item=3851176026&perks=3418782618,3047969693
dimwishlist:item=3851176026&perks=3418782618,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=3851176026&perks=2779035018,2048641572

//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVP) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Tough weapon to judge for PvE. On the surface it looks underwhelming, but there are some interesting perks in here to note. I should also note that this weapon has literally double the base reload of the rest of its archetype. 60 base reload is insane here and should not be overlooked. Perks-wise this has some ok perks for clearing low-level content like Desperate Measures, Kill Clip, and Adrenaline Junkie, but the fact that this is a void weapon hurts the use case for all of those due to subclass limitations. That leaves Frenzy as the premiere choice for high-end content and oh boy Under-Over and Repulsor Brace as pairings are super juicy here. Under-Over would be ideal for the next time we get an anti-barrier season and Repulsor Brace should be the far more ubiquitous choice for Gyrfalcon Hunter. Overall though this archetype isn’t really used much in PvE. For PvP this can hit max range with the aid of Keep Away and looks like it could be very, very strong - unfortunately the deterministic recoil pattern is horrible on this weapon. Do not run a counterbalance mod, in any configuration it just pulls the recoil poorly. You need one of the 3 recoil-adjusting barrel perks to make this usable at all, preferably Extended Barrel being the premiere choice. The base stats on Elsie’s are huge. It’s like having a Messenger with 3 adept mods already on it (2 in reload, 1 in handling). Overall, this is looking like a great chase for PvP, so making it a #4 prio. " Masterwork: Range
dimwishlist:item=3851176026&perks=1467527085,1885400500,2387244414,460017080

//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVP) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Tough weapon to judge for PvE. On the surface it looks underwhelming, but there are some interesting perks in here to note. I should also note that this weapon has literally double the base reload of the rest of its archetype. 60 base reload is insane here and should not be overlooked. Perks-wise this has some ok perks for clearing low-level content like Desperate Measures, Kill Clip, and Adrenaline Junkie, but the fact that this is a void weapon hurts the use case for all of those due to subclass limitations. That leaves Frenzy as the premiere choice for high-end content and oh boy Under-Over and Repulsor Brace as pairings are super juicy here. Under-Over would be ideal for the next time we get an anti-barrier season and Repulsor Brace should be the far more ubiquitous choice for Gyrfalcon Hunter. Overall though this archetype isn’t really used much in PvE. For PvP this can hit max range with the aid of Keep Away and looks like it could be very, very strong - unfortunately the deterministic recoil pattern is horrible on this weapon. Do not run a counterbalance mod, in any configuration it just pulls the recoil poorly. You need one of the 3 recoil-adjusting barrel perks to make this usable at all, preferably Extended Barrel being the premiere choice. The base stats on Elsie’s are huge. It’s like having a Messenger with 3 adept mods already on it (2 in reload, 1 in handling). Overall, this is looking like a great chase for PvP, so making it a #4 prio. " Masterwork: Range

// MIDNIGHT COUP
//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "The return of one of the best weapons from Y1 of D2. They’ve buffed the base stat package here and juiced up the perk pool. This should supplant Fatebringer (even the timelost versions) as the premiere PvE kinetic slot handcannon for high-end content. Deterministic recoil here really sucks, and neither of the +10 barrels actually fixes it, so you’d just be looking for Arrowhead Brake. The biggest chase should be Shoot to Loot + Kinetic Tremors, but Attrition Orbs (the tremors count to attrition stacks) paired with Tremors is also a dynamite roll I’d suggest keeping as well. The weapon needs reload help at base to help it out. I’d recommend at least 71 (maybe 66) in reload stat, but you’d really be happy with 81. This makes the jump in reload from a Firefly proc fairly meaningless, and the actual damage from a firefly proc is pretty lackluster in a small radius (especially in high-end content), so even though people are going nuts over it I honestly wouldn’t recommend it. The best current roll then would be to go for either Explosive Payload + Frenzy or one of the Kinetic Tremors rolls mentioned above (EP, Attrition, or Shoot). For the classic Fatebringer roll (EP+Frenzy) this weapon has worse stats (Range & Stab since Frenzy maxes out Handling and Reload), but the perks can be enhanced and it has a pretty good origin trait compared to the rather meaningless adept mods that Fatebringer can get on its Timelost version. Without Arrowhead Brake though this weapon won’t feel as good as Fatebringer does. Tough to get a good roll on this since you need the perk combo AND reload help AND arrowhead brake. This is high priority (#3)." Masterwork: Reload
dimwishlist:item=2763843898&perks=839105230,3230963543,3700496672,3891536761
dimwishlist:item=2763843898&perks=839105230,3230963543,3700496672,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=2763843898&perks=839105230,3230963543,3038247973,3891536761
dimwishlist:item=2763843898&perks=839105230,3230963543,3038247973,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=2763843898&perks=839105230,3230963543,243981275,3891536761
dimwishlist:item=2763843898&perks=839105230,3230963543,243981275,4104185692

//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "The return of one of the best weapons from Y1 of D2. They’ve buffed the base stat package here and juiced up the perk pool. This should supplant Fatebringer (even the timelost versions) as the premiere PvE kinetic slot handcannon for high-end content. Deterministic recoil here really sucks, and neither of the +10 barrels actually fixes it, so you’d just be looking for Arrowhead Brake. The biggest chase should be Shoot to Loot + Kinetic Tremors, but Attrition Orbs (the tremors count to attrition stacks) paired with Tremors is also a dynamite roll I’d suggest keeping as well. The weapon needs reload help at base to help it out. I’d recommend at least 71 (maybe 66) in reload stat, but you’d really be happy with 81. This makes the jump in reload from a Firefly proc fairly meaningless, and the actual damage from a firefly proc is pretty lackluster in a small radius (especially in high-end content), so even though people are going nuts over it I honestly wouldn’t recommend it. The best current roll then would be to go for either Explosive Payload + Frenzy or one of the Kinetic Tremors rolls mentioned above (EP, Attrition, or Shoot). For the classic Fatebringer roll (EP+Frenzy) this weapon has worse stats (Range & Stab since Frenzy maxes out Handling and Reload), but the perks can be enhanced and it has a pretty good origin trait compared to the rather meaningless adept mods that Fatebringer can get on its Timelost version. Without Arrowhead Brake though this weapon won’t feel as good as Fatebringer does. Tough to get a good roll on this since you need the perk combo AND reload help AND arrowhead brake. This is high priority (#3)." Masterwork: Reload

// MIDNIGHT COUP (Holofoil)
//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "The return of one of the best weapons from Y1 of D2. They’ve buffed the base stat package here and juiced up the perk pool. This should supplant Fatebringer (even the timelost versions) as the premiere PvE kinetic slot handcannon for high-end content. Deterministic recoil here really sucks, and neither of the +10 barrels actually fixes it, so you’d just be looking for Arrowhead Brake. The biggest chase should be Shoot to Loot + Kinetic Tremors, but Attrition Orbs (the tremors count to attrition stacks) paired with Tremors is also a dynamite roll I’d suggest keeping as well. The weapon needs reload help at base to help it out. I’d recommend at least 71 (maybe 66) in reload stat, but you’d really be happy with 81. This makes the jump in reload from a Firefly proc fairly meaningless, and the actual damage from a firefly proc is pretty lackluster in a small radius (especially in high-end content), so even though people are going nuts over it I honestly wouldn’t recommend it. The best current roll then would be to go for either Explosive Payload + Frenzy or one of the Kinetic Tremors rolls mentioned above (EP, Attrition, or Shoot). For the classic Fatebringer roll (EP+Frenzy) this weapon has worse stats (Range & Stab since Frenzy maxes out Handling and Reload), but the perks can be enhanced and it has a pretty good origin trait compared to the rather meaningless adept mods that Fatebringer can get on its Timelost version. Without Arrowhead Brake though this weapon won’t feel as good as Fatebringer does. Tough to get a good roll on this since you need the perk combo AND reload help AND arrowhead brake. This is high priority (#3)." Masterwork: Reload
dimwishlist:item=2499720827&perks=839105230,3230963543,3700496672,3891536761
dimwishlist:item=2499720827&perks=839105230,3230963543,3700496672,4104185692

dimwishlist:item=2499720827&perks=839105230,3230963543,243981275,4104185692

//notes: SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "The return of one of the best weapons from Y1 of D2. They’ve buffed the base stat package here and juiced up the perk pool. This should supplant Fatebringer (even the timelost versions) as the premiere PvE kinetic slot handcannon for high-end content. Deterministic recoil here really sucks, and neither of the +10 barrels actually fixes it, so you’d just be looking for Arrowhead Brake. The biggest chase should be Shoot to Loot + Kinetic Tremors, but Attrition Orbs (the tremors count to attrition stacks) paired with Tremors is also a dynamite roll I’d suggest keeping as well. The weapon needs reload help at base to help it out. I’d recommend at least 71 (maybe 66) in reload stat, but you’d really be happy with 81. This makes the jump in reload from a Firefly proc fairly meaningless, and the actual damage from a firefly proc is pretty lackluster in a small radius (especially in high-end content), so even though people are going nuts over it I honestly wouldn’t recommend it. The best current roll then would be to go for either Explosive Payload + Frenzy or one of the Kinetic Tremors rolls mentioned above (EP, Attrition, or Shoot). For the classic Fatebringer roll (EP+Frenzy) this weapon has worse stats (Range & Stab since Frenzy maxes out Handling and Reload), but the perks can be enhanced and it has a pretty good origin trait compared to the rather meaningless adept mods that Fatebringer can get on its Timelost version. Without Arrowhead Brake though this weapon won’t feel as good as Fatebringer does. Tough to get a good roll on this since you need the perk combo AND reload help AND arrowhead brake. This is high priority (#3)." Masterwork: Reload

//LUNA'S HOWL
//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Pretty interesting weapon as it is a unique archetype, being a precision but shooting at 140rpm. This gun used to be a beast in the crucible and very well may be again, with tons of perks in both columns that should be very usable. In PvE once you can enhance it this should be a legitimate contender to Zaouli’s Bane. Overall this should be a decent choice to chase once you have other rolls - #7." Masterwork: Reload
dimwishlist:item=2763843899&perks=4090651448,3230963543,3017780555,4293542123

//LUNA'S HOWL (Holofoil)
//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Pretty interesting weapon as it is a unique archetype, being a precision but shooting at 140rpm. This gun used to be a beast in the crucible and very well may be again, with tons of perks in both columns that should be very usable. In PvE once you can enhance it this should be a legitimate contender to Zaouli’s Bane. Overall this should be a decent choice to chase once you have other rolls - #7." Masterwork: Reload
dimwishlist:item=3757612024&perks=4090651448,3230963543,3017780555,4293542123

//SUCCESSION
//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Oof. From the top to the bottom of these new weapons. There is actually no reason to get this gun at all. The raid version is strictly better in every way as this brings no better or more interesting perk pairings, and the Bray Inheritance origin trait is just a better version of Indomitability. The only thing that could be said here is that Discord is at least something different in perk slot 1, but you’d have to eschew Reconstruction for that, and ultimately what would be the point? I get that it prints free ammo, but why are you using an aggressive sniper rifle for add clear? This weapon makes no sense to reissue and should be the only hard avoid on the list. #12 and it isn’t close. " Masterwork: Handling

//SUCCESSION (Holofoil)
//notes: BOLD SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide (PVE) https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KGxePntz2loCYlAhdKm0fJyyf_YURJ1Zd7L1smsu4-c "Oof. From the top to the bottom of these new weapons. There is actually no reason to get this gun at all. The raid version is strictly better in every way as this brings no better or more interesting perk pairings, and the Bray Inheritance origin trait is just a better version of Indomitability. The only thing that could be said here is that Discord is at least something different in perk slot 1, but you’d have to eschew Reconstruction for that, and ultimately what would be the point? I get that it prints free ammo, but why are you using an aggressive sniper rifle for add clear? This weapon makes no sense to reissue and should be the only hard avoid on the list. #12 and it isn’t close. " Masterwork: Handling
